entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 5:07AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Visibility reductions will impact portions of the Tennessee Valley early this morning... entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG DEVELOPING THIS MORNING... entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 17 at 4:09AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 2:47AM PDT until September 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND MONDAY... .A pair of dry cold fronts will sweep through the region Sunday and Monday, making for breezy conditions during the afternoon and evening hours each day. Winds are expected to be at their strongest on Monday, with RHs remaining at critical levels despite cooler conditions prevailing behind Sunday`s front.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued September 17 at 5:59AM AST until September 17 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heat indices of 108-111 degrees Fahrenheit. * WHERE...Northwest, San Juan and Vicinity, northeast and eastern interior of Puerto Rico and St. Croix. * WHEN...through 5 PM AST this afternoon.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 2:47AM PDT until September 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND MONDAY... .A pair of dry cold fronts will sweep through the region Sunday and Monday, making for breezy conditions during the afternoon and evening hours each day. Winds are expected to be at their strongest on Monday, with RHs remaining at critical levels despite cooler conditions prevailing behind Sunday`s front.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 2:39AM PDT until September 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Dry and Breezy Conditions on Sunday followed by Windy conditions Monday... .A mid level wave will usher in dry and breezy conditions for Sunday. A strong dry cold front on Monday will deliver windy conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia Basin, Palouse, Spokane Area; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued September 17 at 5:09AM CDT until September 17 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter to one half mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland, Burnett, Washburn and Sawyer Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Red Cliff Band, the St. Croix Band in Burnett County, the Bad River Reservation and the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:35AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG THROUGH 9 AM... * WHAT...Pockets of very low visibilities under a quarter of a mile. * WHERE...Portions of central Minnesota and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Barron; Chippewa; Dunn; Eau Claire; Polk; Rusk; St. Croix
